channel.title: Help? When I add and compile stuff... It don't show
channel.description:
I was wondering if every got the
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .
I know that means its compiled successfully, but then if I do runserver.bat or run.bat, the updates don't show. Will someone please help me?

item.title: Help? When I add and compile stuff... It don't show
item.dc:creator: @Irwinner21 Irwinner21
item.description:
@Irwinner21 wrote:

I even used tab instead of spacebar. Sick, if you have hamachi, join doaupk <all caps pass 123, ip 5.59.204.155 and check it out please.[br][size=1]Posted on: May 19, 2007, 12:24:23 PM[/size][hr]No-one knows whats up with this?

Read full topic

item.title: Help? When I add and compile stuff... It don't show
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

Here’s my little tutorial on making shops…

Ok, open up shops.cfg. Add this

shop = ##	NAMEOFSHOP					2	2	ITEMID	AMOUNT	ITEMID	AMOUNT

Replace the required things. Now open up autospawn.cfg. Add this underneath your Aubury spawn

spawn = NPCID	XCOORD	YCOORD	0	0	0	0	0	1	Joe shop

Replace the required things. Now open up client.java and under

WanneShop = 2; //Aubury Magic Shop

add this

} else if (NPCID == NPCOFID) { //SHOPNAME PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = ##; //SHOPNAME
Replace the required things, but ~DO NOT TOUCH “NPCID”~. Now save, compile and run.

Read full topic
item.source: Help? When I add and compile stuff... It don't show

item.title: Help? When I add and compile stuff... It don't show
item.dc:creator: @Irwinner21 Irwinner21
item.description:
@Irwinner21 wrote:

O.o[br][size=1]Posted on: May 19, 2007, 11:48:47 AM[/size][hr]Oh, I see what’s up… Whenever I try and save a .cfg it doesn’t work when I compile it. How do I save/fix the .cfg… When I open it with notepad, then edit, then save, then open again, all the files I edit are still there…

Read full topic
item.source: Help? When I add and compile stuff... It don't show

item.title: Help? When I add and compile stuff... It don't show
item.dc:creator: @Wreckaz Wreckaz
item.description:
@Wreckaz wrote:

[quote=“Irwinner21, post:17, topic:96963”]Thank’s man, I’d rep ya if I could, you’ve been a great help. Just hope I figure out defenders =P[br][size=1]Posted on: May 19, 2007, 11:42:27 AM[/size][hr][quote author=I Br3ndan I link=topic=139632.msg1342725#msg1342725 date=1179613584]
Shops go like this…

shop = 40	Shop_Name					2	2	6137	10	6139	10	6141	10	6147	10	6153	10	7386	10	7390	10	7394	10

Now. I’ll explain what each part is for. :eek:

shop = 40

This is the shop number, it’s there so that the server knows which NPC has a shop and which doesn’t. Leave this as it is.

shop_name

This is the shop’s name (Hence the title), you can change this to annyytthhing you wan’t. Just make sure you use _ instead of spaces. You can also add colour to this, see my ‘Modifying a Source’ thread for more information on colours.

	6139	10	6141	10	6147	10	6153	10	7386	10	7390	10	7394	10

Those are the item ID’s. You can change those to anything you wan’t. The 1st number (6139) is the item ID and the second is the amount of that item. Remember;When putting new items in a shop, be sure to use TABS, not SPACEBAR.
[/quote]

Whats this in?[/quote]
its in Shop.CFG

Read full topic

shop = 40

shop_name

This is the shop’s name (Hence the title), you can change this to annyytthhing you wan’t. Just make sure you use _ instead of spaces. You can also add colour to this, see my ‘Modifying a Source’ thread for more information on colours.

	6139	10	6141	10	6147	10	6153	10	7386	10	7390	10	7394	10

Those are the item ID’s. You can change those to anything you wan’t. The 1st number (6139) is the item ID and the second is the amount of that item. Remember;When putting new items in a shop, be sure to use TABS, not SPACEBAR.[/quote]

Whats this in?

Shops go like this…

shop = 40	Shop_Name					2	2	6137	10	6139	10	6141	10	6147	10	6153	10	7386	10	7390	10	7394	10

Now. I’ll explain what each part is for. :eek:

shop = 40

This is the shop number, it’s there so that the server knows which NPC has a shop and which doesn’t. Leave this as it is.

shop_name

This is the shop’s name (Hence the title), you can change this to annyytthhing you wan’t. Just make sure you use _ instead of spaces. You can also add colour to this, see my ‘Modifying a Source’ thread for more information on colours.

	6139	10	6141	10	6147	10	6153	10	7386	10	7390	10	7394	10

Those are the item ID’s. You can change those to anything you wan’t. The 1st number (6139) is the item ID and the second is the amount of that item. Remember;When putting new items in a shop, be sure to use TABS, not SPACEBAR.

item.title: Help? When I add and compile stuff... It don't show
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Go into item.CFG and search each Dagger, E.G; Rune;

item = 1213	Rune_dagger	A_powerful_dagger.	5481.21625356715	5481.21625356715	6781.98665026973	25	12	-4	1	0	0	0	0	1	0	24	0

If you wanted it to be much better, you would do something like this…

item = 1213	Rune_dagger	A_powerful_dagger.	5481.21625356715	5481.21625356715	6781.98665026973	25	12	21	21	24	54	34	23	14	34	42	24

Save item.CFG and compile. Then it should take effect.

Read full topic

item.title: Help? When I add and compile stuff... It don't show
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

For the defender thing; Go into Item.Java and search for this;

	public static int shields[] = {

You should see something like this;

	public static int shields[] = {7350,2997,7352,7354,7356,7358,7360,7348,7346,7344,7342,7340,7338,7336,6894,6631,6633,6889,7332,7334,1171,1173,1175,1177,1179,1181,1183,1185,1187,1189,1191,1193,1195,1197,1199,1201,1540,2589,2597,2603,2611,2621,2629,2659,2667,2675,2890,3122,3488,3758,3839,3840,3841,3842,3843,3844,4072,4156,4224,4225,4226,4227,4228,4229,4230,4231,4232,4233,4234,4302,4507,4512,6215,6217,6219,6221,6223,6225,6227,6229,6231,6233,6235,6237,6239,6241,6243,6245,6247,6249,6251,6253,6255,6257,6259,6261,6263,6265,6267,6269,6271,6273,6275,6277,6279,6524};

What you wan’t to do is, put the item ID’s for the Daggers in there and from then on, once you equip a Dagger it’ll go into the sheild slot instead of the weapon slot.

Read full topic

I set them as a shield and put the stats were I wanted them, saved, compiled, ran. Didn’t work. No errors though. =P Plus, I need to know a link to a tut of how to add items to npc’s.
